label: Calendly API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the calendly API.

tools.name: CancelScheduledEvent
tools.description:
Cancels a specified scheduled event on Calendly.

Use this tool to cancel a scheduled event by providing its unique identifier. It should be called when you need to remove an event from your calendar.

parameters.name: event_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event to be canceled.

parameters.name: cancellation_reason
parameters.description: The reason for canceling the event. Provide a clear and concise explanation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateCustomShareLink
tools.description:
Create a shareable link for a customized event.

Use this tool to generate a customized shareable link for one-on-one event types on Calendly. This tool should be called when you want to tailor event details for a specific invitee without creating a new event type. Note: Any details not specified will be inherited from the existing event.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateEventInvitee
tools.description:
Create a new event invitee on Calendly.

This tool is used to create a new event invitee on Calendly. It triggers standard notifications, calendar invites, reschedules, and workflows as if booked via the Calendly interface. Note that only users on paid Calendly plans can access this feature.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateEventType
tools.description:
Create a new one-on-one event type in Calendly.

This tool is used to create a new one-on-one event type in Calendly. It is useful when scheduling personalized meetings or appointments.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name":"One-on-One Meeting","duration":30,"location":"Zoom","description":"A personalized one-on-one meeting to discuss project updates."}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateOneOffEvent
tools.description:
Create a one-off event type in Calendly.

This tool is used to create a one-off event type in Calendly, allowing users to schedule unique events not linked to recurring event types.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"event_name": "Team Sync Meeting", "event_start": "2023-10-10T10:00:00Z", "event_duration": 60, "event_description": "Monthly sync meeting to align teams."}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateSchedulingLink
tools.description: Creates a single-use scheduling link for appointments.

parameters.name: maximum_event_count
parameters.description: The maximum number of events that can be scheduled using this link. Currently, only '1' is supported.

parameters.name: resource_owner_link
parameters.description: A link to the resource owning this scheduling link, typically an Event Type URL.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Resource type for the scheduling link. This is always 'EventType'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateWebhookSubscription
tools.description:
Create a webhook subscription for events in Calendly.

Use this tool to set up a webhook subscription for either an organization, user, or group. It triggers on specified events like invitee creation or cancellation. Useful for integrating Calendly events with other applications or systems.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description: The endpoint URL to receive POST requests for subscribed events in Calendly.

parameters.name: event_subscriptions
parameters.description: List of user events to subscribe to. Examples include 'invitee.created', 'invitee.canceled', etc.

parameters.name: organization_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference identifier for the organization associated with the webhook.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription_scope
parameters.description: Specifies the scope of the webhook subscription: "organization", "user", or "group".

parameters.name: group_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference to the group that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: user_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference or ID of the user for whom the webhook will be tied.

parameters.name: webhook_signing_key
parameters.description: Optional secret key shared between your application and Calendly for verifying webhook signatures. Useful for ensuring webhook messages' authenticity.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteInviteeData
tools.description:
Request removal of invitee data from all booked events.

Use this tool to submit a request for deleting an invitee's data from all previously booked events within your organization. It requires an Enterprise subscription and can take up to 7 days to complete.

parameters.name: invitee_email_list
parameters.description: A list of invitee emails to remove data for from all booked events. Each entry should be a valid email address.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteScheduledEventsData
tools.description:
Delete scheduled events data within a past time range.

Use this tool to request the deletion of scheduled events data for your organization within a specified past time range, up to 24 months. Completion may take up to 7 days. Requires an Enterprise subscription.

parameters.name: deletion_start_time_utc
parameters.description: The UTC timestamp to start deleting scheduled events data. Must be in the past and not older than 24 months.

parameters.name: end_time_utc
parameters.description: The UTC timestamp marking the end of the time range for data deletion, in the past, no greater than 24 months ago.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteWebhookSubscription
tools.description:
Delete a webhook subscription on Calendly.

Use this tool to delete a specific webhook subscription from Calendly by providing the webhook UUID.

parameters.name: webhook_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the webhook subscription to be deleted. This is required to specify which subscription will be removed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchEventTypeHosts
tools.description:
Fetches a list of event type hosts from Calendly.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of hosts for event types on Calendly. This can be useful to determine availability or to manage event type assignments.

parameters.name: event_type_uri
parameters.description: The URI associated with the event type to identify the hosts.

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of rows to fetch from the list of event type hosts. This determines the size of the dataset returned.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for fetching the next or previous portion of the event type host list.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchOutgoingCommunications
tools.description:
Retrieve outgoing SMS and email communications.

Fetches a list of outgoing SMS and email communications for users with an Enterprise subscription.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: Return outgoing communications from the organization associated with this URI. This should be a valid URI string.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Include outgoing communications created before this time in UTC format (e.g., "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z").

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: The maximum number of outgoing communications records to retrieve.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for fetching the next set of outgoing communications.

parameters.name: start_time_utc
parameters.description: Include communications created after this UTC time (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z").

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCalendlyUserInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve user information from Calendly.

Call this tool to get detailed information about a specific Calendly user using their UUID.

parameters.name: user_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user. Use 'me' to reference the caller.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEventAvailability
tools.description:
Retrieve availability for a specific event type.

This tool returns the availability schedule for a given event type. It should be called when you need to check open time slots for booking or planning purposes.

parameters.name: event_type_uri
parameters.description: The URI associated with the specific event type to retrieve availability.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEventDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a specified scheduled event.

Use this tool to get details about a specific event scheduled in Calendly, using the event's unique identifier.

parameters.name: event_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event to retrieve details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEventInviteeInfo
tools.description:
Fetch information about a specific event invitee.

Use this tool to obtain detailed information about an invitee for a particular scheduled event on Calendly. Call this when you need specifics about a person invited to an event, identified by event and invitee UUIDs.

parameters.name: event_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific Calendly event. Use this to specify which event's invitee details to retrieve.

parameters.name: invitee_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the invitee for a specific event.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEventTypeInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a specified event type on Calendly.

Use this tool to obtain detailed information about a specific event type by providing its unique identifier (UUID). It's useful for understanding the configuration and settings of different event types in your Calendly account.

parameters.name: event_type_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) for the event type to be retrieved.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetGroupInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a specified group in Calendly.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific group in Calendly by providing the group's UUID.

parameters.name: group_unique_identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the group whose information is to be retrieved from Calendly.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetGroupList
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of groups from Calendly.

Use this tool to obtain information about the various groups available in Calendly. It returns a list detailing these groups.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: URI for the organization to return associated groups from Calendly.

parameters.name: number_of_rows
parameters.description: Specify the number of rows (groups) to return from the query. Used to limit results.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for retrieving the next or previous set of groups in the list.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetGroupRelationshipByUuid
tools.description:
Retrieve group relationship details using a UUID.

This tool fetches the details of a group relationship in Calendly by using the unique identifier (UUID). Use it when you need to access specific group relationship information.

parameters.name: group_relationship_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the group relationship to retrieve details for. Use this to specify which relationship to fetch.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetInviteeNoShowDetails
tools.description:
Fetch details of a specified invitee no-show.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about an invitee who did not show up for a scheduled event. This is helpful for managing scheduling follow-ups or analyzing attendance patterns.

parameters.name: invitee_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the invitee whose no-show information is being requested.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetOrganizationDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specified organization using UUID.

Call this tool to obtain comprehensive information about an organization by providing its unique UUID.

parameters.name: organization_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization to retrieve details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetOrganizationInvitation
tools.description:
Fetches details of an organization's invitation.

Use this tool to retrieve information about an invitation sent within an organization to its members. This can help track invitation status and details.

parameters.name: organization_invitation_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization's invitation. Provide this to retrieve specific invitation details.

parameters.name: organization_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetOrganizationMembershipInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details about a user's organization membership in Calendly.

Use this tool to get information about a specific user's membership within an organization on Calendly. This tool can be called when you need detailed membership data for a given user, identified by their unique UUID.

parameters.name: organization_membership_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization's membership to retrieve details for a user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetOrganizationMemberships
tools.description:
Retrieve organization memberships and related details.

Use this tool to list the organization memberships for all users in an organization. You can also retrieve your organization's URI using this endpoint.

parameters.name: filter_by_email
parameters.description: A specific email address to filter the organization memberships by. Only memberships associated with this email will be returned.

parameters.name: filter_by_organization
parameters.description: Filter the results by organization. Provide the organization's unique identifier or name to retrieve specific memberships.

parameters.name: filter_by_role
parameters.description: Filter the results by role. Options: 'owner', 'admin', 'user'.

parameters.name: filter_by_user
parameters.description: Filter the results by a specific user. Provide the user's identifier to narrow the search.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Token used to retrieve the next or previous set of results for paginated data.

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of rows to return in the response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetRoutingForm
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specified routing form.

Call this tool to obtain information about a specific routing form using its UUID.

parameters.name: routing_form_uuid
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the routing form to be retrieved.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetRoutingFormSubmission
tools.description:
Retrieve a specified Routing Form Submission by UUID.

This tool retrieves information about a specific routing form submission identified by its unique UUID. Use it to access details of a specific form submission in Calendly.

parameters.name: submission_uuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the routing form submission to be retrieved.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSampleWebhookData
tools.description:
Retrieve sample webhook data for testing integrations.

Use this tool to obtain a sample webhook payload from Calendly for testing your webhook subscription integration. This is useful for developers who want to ensure their systems can properly handle the data structure and content sent by Calendly webhooks before going live.

parameters.name: organization_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization. It specifies which organization the sample webhook data belongs to.

parameters.name: webhook_event_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of webhook event to simulate, such as 'invitee.created' or 'invitee.canceled'.

parameters.name: webhook_scope
parameters.description: Specify the scope for the sample webhook data. Options are 'user', 'organization', or 'group'.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a user in Calendly whose webhook data you want to test.

parameters.name: webhook_event_group
parameters.description: Specify the group for the webhook event to categorize and filter data. Typically used for organizing related webhooks.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserAccountInfo
tools.description: Retrieve basic information about the current Calendly user.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserAvailabilitySchedule
tools.description:
Retrieve a user's availability schedule using their UUID.

Use this tool to obtain the availability schedule for a specific user identified by their UUID. It provides the details of available time slots.

parameters.name: user_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the availability schedule you want to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserAvailabilitySchedules
tools.description:
Fetch a user's availability schedules.

Use this tool to get the availability schedules of a specified user, assisting in planning or checking user availability.

parameters.name: user_uri_reference
parameters.description: A URI reference to the specified user whose availability schedules are to be retrieved.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserLocationInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve configured location details for a specific user.

This tool is used to obtain the location information that a user has configured in their account. It can be called when location details are needed for scheduling or meeting purposes.

parameters.name: user_uri
parameters.description: The URI identifying the specific user to retrieve location information for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetWebhookSubscription
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific webhook subscription.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific webhook subscription by providing its unique identifier.

parameters.name: webhook_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook subscription to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: InviteUserToOrganization
tools.description:
Invite a user to join an organization.

This tool sends an invitation to a user to join a specific organization on Calendly. Use it when you need to add a new member to an organization by sending them an invitation.

parameters.name: organization_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization to which the user is being invited.

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: The email address of the user to be invited to the organization.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListActivityLogEntries
tools.description:
Fetch a list of activity log entries.

This tool retrieves a list of activity log entries from Calendly, requiring an Enterprise subscription. It is useful for accessing detailed logs of various activities.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: URI of the organization to filter activity log entries.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Specify one or more actions associated with the log entries. Accepts an array of strings.

parameters.name: entry_categories
parameters.description: Specify the categories of log entries to filter the results. This is an array of strings, each representing a category.

parameters.name: filter_by_search_term
parameters.description: Filters entries using supported operators: `|`, `+`, `"`, `-`, `()`, `*`. For example, `this | that` or `(email) + (signup)`.

parameters.name: include_entries_after
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred after this time. Use format: "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ" (UTC).

parameters.name: max_occurred_at_time
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this UTC time in the format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ".

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the number of activity log entries to return in the response.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to get the next portion of the activity log collection.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the field and direction to sort results. Use format {field}:{direction}.

parameters.name: user_associated_uris
parameters.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs. This should be an array of strings representing the URIs of users.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListAvailableEventTimes
tools.description:
Retrieve available times for an event type within a date range.

Returns available times for a specified event type within a maximum 7-day date range. Useful for scheduling and planning events.

parameters.name: availability_end_time
parameters.description: End time for the availability range, must be after the start time.

parameters.name: availability_start_time
parameters.description: The start time for the availability range. Must be a future date, not in the past.

parameters.name: event_type_uri
parameters.description: The URI associated with the event type to retrieve its available times.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListEventInvitees
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of invitees for a given event.

Use this tool to obtain details about all invitees for a specific event. The tool is suitable when you need to see who has been invited to an event using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: event_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event whose invitees are being retrieved.

parameters.name: filter_by_email
parameters.description: Specify an email address to filter invitees by email.

parameters.name: invitee_status
parameters.description: Filter invitees by their status: 'active' for current invitees or 'canceled' for those who have canceled.

parameters.name: number_of_invitees_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the number of invitee rows to return in the response.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: A token to retrieve the next or previous page of invitees. Useful for paginated responses.

parameters.name: sort_order_by_created_at
parameters.description: Specify the order of results based on the creation date as 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListEventTypes
tools.description:
Fetches event types for a specified user or organization.

This tool retrieves all event types associated with a specified user or organization in Calendly. Use it when you need to get a list of event types for scheduling or management purposes.

parameters.name: number_of_event_types_to_return
parameters.description: The number of event types to return. Specify the desired count of returned rows.

parameters.name: only_admin_managed
parameters.description: Return only admin managed event types if true, exclude them if false, or include all if omitted.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: URI to view available personal, team, and organization event types.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to retrieve the next or previous set of event types in pagination.

parameters.name: return_active_event_types_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only active event types, false for only inactive, or omit to include all event types.

parameters.name: sort_event_types_by
parameters.description: Specify field and direction to order results. Use {field}:{asc/desc}. Fields: name, position, created_at, updated_at.

parameters.name: user_availability_schedule_filter
parameters.description: Filters event types by the given primary availability schedule when used with the 'user' parameter.

parameters.name: user_uri
parameters.description: The user's URI to view associated personal, team, and organization event types.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListGroupRelationships
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of group relationships for a given owner.

Use this tool to get group relationship records, including one membership and multiple admin records for an owner.

parameters.name: filter_by_group
parameters.description: Filter results by a specific group using a group identifier.

parameters.name: filter_by_organization
parameters.description: Filter results by organization. Provide the organization ID or URI to narrow down the list of group relationships.

parameters.name: filter_by_owner_uri
parameters.description: The URI to filter results by owner, either an Organization Membership URI or Organization Invitation URI.

parameters.name: number_of_rows
parameters.description: Specify the number of rows to return in the response.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token to navigate to the next or previous portion of the collection.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListOrganizationInvitations
tools.description:
Retrieve organization invitations sent to members.

Use this tool to get a list of invitations that have been sent to members of a specific organization. This tool is useful for tracking pending or accepted invitations within the organization.

parameters.name: organization_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization to retrieve invitations for.

parameters.name: filter_by_email
parameters.description: Email address to filter the results of organization invitations.

parameters.name: filter_by_status
parameters.description: Filter results by invitation status: 'pending', 'accepted', or 'declined'.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for fetching the next or previous set of organization invitations.

parameters.name: rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of organization invitation records to retrieve in the request.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the field and direction (ascending or descending) for sorting results. Use a comma-separated list for multiple criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListRoutingForms
tools.description:
Retrieve routing forms for a specified organization.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all routing forms associated with a specific organization. It should be called when there is a need to access routing forms data for organizational purposes.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: The URI of the organization to view its routing forms. It should be a valid string representing the organization's endpoint.

parameters.name: number_of_rows
parameters.description: The number of routing form entries to return for the request.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for fetching the next or previous portion of the routing forms collection.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order of results using field and direction. Supports 'created_at' with 'asc' or 'desc'. Use comma for multiple fields.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListRoutingFormSubmissions
tools.description:
Get a list of Routing Form Submissions for a specified form.

Use this tool to retrieve submissions from a specific routing form in your Calendly account. Ideal for accessing user responses collected through these forms.

parameters.name: routing_form_uri
parameters.description: The URI of the routing form to view its submissions. This specifies which form's submissions to retrieve.

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of routing form submissions to return.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for retrieving the next or previous set of form submissions.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify field and direction to sort results (e.g., 'created_at:asc').

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListScheduledEvents
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of scheduled events from Calendly.

Use this tool to get scheduled events based on specific criteria. Pass the 'organization' parameter to fetch events for an organization, 'user' for personal or specific user events, and 'group' for group events. Admins or owners have additional privileges for broader queries.

parameters.name: event_status
parameters.description: Indicate if the event is 'active' or 'canceled'.

parameters.name: events_sort_order
parameters.description: Specify sorting order for events. Use 'start_time:asc' or 'start_time:desc'.

parameters.name: group_uri
parameters.description: URI of the group to fetch scheduled events for. Requires admin/owner or group admin privilege.

parameters.name: invitee_email
parameters.description: Email address of the invitee to filter and return related scheduled events.

parameters.name: max_start_time_utc
parameters.description: Include events with start times prior to this UTC time. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ

parameters.name: min_start_time
parameters.description: Include events starting after this UTC time. Format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z".

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of event entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: URI of the organization to retrieve scheduled events for. Requires admin/owner privileges.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for navigating to the next or previous set of scheduled events.

parameters.name: user_uri
parameters.description: URI identifying the user for whom to return scheduled events. Use alone for personal events or with 'organization' for specific user events within an organization.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListUserBusyTimes
tools.description:
Retrieve user's scheduled events within a specific date range.

Use this tool to obtain an ascending list of all internal and external events scheduled for a user within a specified date range, up to 7 days. External events are returned only if calendars are set to "Check for conflicts." This tool is helpful for checking availability or scheduling new events based on the user's current commitments.

parameters.name: availability_start_time
parameters.description: Start time for the availability range. The date must not be in the past.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time for the requested availability range, must be after the start_time.

parameters.name: user_uri
parameters.description: The URI associated with the user to retrieve busy times for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListWebhookSubscriptions
tools.description:
Retrieve webhook subscriptions for an organization or user.

Use this tool to obtain a list of webhook subscriptions associated with a specified organization or user on Calendly.

parameters.name: filter_scope
parameters.description: Filter the list by organization, user, or group. Acceptable values are 'organization', 'user', or 'group'.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the organization that owns the subscriptions being returned. This field is always required.

parameters.name: filter_by_group
parameters.description: Optional; filters the results by group when scope is set to 'group'.

parameters.name: filter_by_user
parameters.description: Filter results by user when 'scope' is set to 'user'.

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of rows to be returned in the result set.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next or previous portion of the collection.

parameters.name: sort_by_field_and_direction
parameters.description: Specify the field and direction to order results. Use 'created_at:asc' or 'created_at:desc'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: MarkInviteeNoShow
tools.description:
Mark an invitee as a no show in Calendly.

Use this tool to mark an invitee as a no show in Calendly. It should be called when you need to record that an invitee did not attend a scheduled event.

parameters.name: invitee_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the invitee to be marked as a no show. This is required to specify which invitee did not attend.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RemoveUserFromOrganization
tools.description:
Remove a user from an organization with admin rights.

This tool removes a user from an organization in Calendly. It requires the caller to have admin rights and cannot be used to remove an organization owner.

parameters.name: organization_membership_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization membership to be removed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RevokeOrganizationInvitation
tools.description:
Revoke an organization invitation in Calendly.

Use this tool to revoke an organization invitation in Calendly, rendering the invitation link invalid.

parameters.name: invitation_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization invitation to be revoked.

parameters.name: organization_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The organization's unique identifier required to revoke the invitation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UndoInviteeNoShowStatus
tools.description:
Undo the no-show status for a Calendly invitee.

This tool removes the no-show status previously assigned to an invitee in Calendly. Use it to correct any erroneous no-show markings.

parameters.name: invitee_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the invitee whose no-show status is to be undone.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateEventAvailability
tools.description:
Update an event type availability schedule.

    Use this tool to modify the availability schedule of an existing calendar event type, such as updating times or days available.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: event_type_uri
parameters.description: URI of the event type to update the availability schedule for.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateEventType
tools.description:
Update details of an existing event type with Calendly.

    Use this tool to update an existing one-on-one event type in Calendly. This tool is specifically for modifying event types categorized as 'solo' or one-on-one.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: event_type_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event type to be updated. This is essential for specifying which one-on-one event type you intend to modify.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
This documentation details the Arcade toolkit for integrating with the Calendly API, enabling developers to efficiently manage scheduling events and invitees. 

**Capabilities**
- Create and cancel scheduled events as well as generate custom share links.
- Manage invitees by adding, removing, or marking their attendance status.
- Retrieve user and organization-specific information such as availability and event types.
- Set up webhook subscriptions for real-time notifications on event changes.

**OAuth**
- Provider: Calendly
- Scopes: None

**Secrets**
- None available in this toolkit.
